line_1: Inspire me, till I lisp an' wink,
line_2: O thou, my MUSE! guid, auld SCOTCH DRINK!

line_1: Inspire me, till I lisp an' wink,
line_2: Whether thro' wimplin worms thou jink,

line_1: Inspire me, till I lisp an' wink,
line_2: Or, richly brown, ream owre the brink,

line_1: By this the Starrs began to wink,
line_2: They skriek, they fly, the Tapers sink,

line_1: He takes her soft hand, and he tips her the wink,
line_2: Come, my dear, let us take a cool walk on the Link.

line_1: Quoth I, 'Before I sleep a wink,
line_2: Sae I gat paper in a blink,

line_1: Quoth I, 'Before I sleep a wink,
line_2: An, down gaed stumpie in the ink:

line_1: Quoth I, 'Before I sleep a wink,
line_2: 'An' if ye winna mak it clink,

line_1: The sweet confusing Blush, the secret Wink,
line_2: The gentle-swimming Walk, the courteous Sink,

line_1: Your heavy eyes begin to wink; —
line_2: With glittering swords, — you nod, — I think

line_1: Each man may nod, or nap, or wink,
line_2: And when it is our turn to drink,

line_1: To follow foolish precedents, and wink
line_2: With both our eyes, is easier than to think,

line_1: At such an error I could wink;
line_2: For, O! it was in vain to think,
